#Text=Of course , one requires to be a little gifted that way and not to be butter-fingered , but what is chiefly necessary is patience and daily practice for long , long years .

_	_	_	_

#Text=His modesty surprised me all the more , because of all performers who are generally infatuated with their own skill , he was the most wonderfully clever one I had met .

#Text=Naturally , like other great artists , he was not understood by the crowd , who confounded him with vulgar tricksters , and his mask only appeared to them a trick the more , and a very common trick into the bargain .

#Text= He must think us very stupid , " they said .

column1: #Text=" How could he possibly aim without having his eyes open ? "
#Text=And they thought there must be imperceptible holes in the oilcloth , a sort of latticework concealed in the material .
#Text=It was useless for him to allow the public to examine the mask for themselves before the exhibition began .
#Text=It was all very well that they could not discover any trick , but they were only all the more convinced that they were being tricked .
#Text=Did not the people know that they ought to be tricked ?
#Text=I had recognized a great artist in the old mountebank , and I was quite sure that he was altogether incapable of any trickery .
#Text=I told him so , while expressing my admiration to him ; and he had been touched by my open admiration and above all by the justice I had done him .

#Text=Thus we became good friends , and he explained to me , very modestly , the real trick which the crowd do not understand , the eternal trick contained in these simple words : " To be gifted by nature and to practice every day for long , long years . "
#Text=He had been especially struck by the certainty which I expressed that any trickery must become impossible to him .
#Text=" Yes , " he said to me ; " quite impossible !

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=And he added , with a look of sudden ferocity :  She understood it , at any rate ! "

column1: #Text=" My strumpet of a wife , " he replied .
